text.headline: business
text.text: China is quietly distancing itself from Russia's sanction-hit economy.

text.headline: asia
text.text: Wang Jixian didn't set out to become the Chinese voice of resistance in Ukraine. The 36-year-old resident of Odesa, a key target in Russia's invasion of the country, simply wanted to show his parents he was fine.

text.headline: china
text.text: In public statements and at international summits, Chinese officials have attempted to stake out a seemingly neutral position on the war in Ukraine, neither condemning Russian actions nor ruling out the possibility Beijing could act as a mediator in a push for peace.

text.headline: economy
text.text: Will China help Russia? That has been a big question since Russia invaded Ukraine last week. The two nations have forged close economic ties in recent years, with Chinese leader Xi Jinping calling Russian President Vladimir Putin his "best and bosom friend" in Moscow in 2019.

text.headline: business
text.text: A rising class of creators in China are racing to get in on live-stream shopping, an emerging form of retail that has become an estimated $66 billion industry.

text.headline: tech
text.text: Wearing a striped shirt and Matrix-style dark glasses, Onel de Guzman stared at the floor as he made his way through a crowd of photographers into a hastily arranged press conference in Quezon City, a suburb of the Philippines capital Manila.

text.headline: politics
text.text: The US has information suggesting China has expressed some openness to providing Russia with requested military and financial assistance as part of its war on Ukraine, a Western official and a US diplomat told CNN, and is conveying what it knows to its NATO allies.

text.headline: economy
text.text: Russia has one obvious ally to turn to as geopolitical sparks fly with the West over Ukraine.

text.headline: asia
text.text: As the sun rose on the morning of June 4, 1989, the Chinese people woke to a country which had changed overnight.

text.headline: china
text.text: Editor's note: CNN will be launching the Meanwhile in China newsletter on June 21, a three-times-a-week update exploring what you need to know about the country's rise and how it impacts the world. Sign up here.

text.headline: asia
text.text: The massacre of unarmed citizens by soldiers in Beijing's Tiananmen Square in 1989, should not be referred to as "suppression," a Chinese Defense Ministry spokesman told reporters Thursday.

text.headline: asia
text.text: As commemorations for the 30th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square massacre take place worldwide Tuesday, any coverage or discussion of the event will be tightly censored in China.

text.headline: media
text.text: One year was all it took for a Beijing-imposed National Security Law to take down Hong Kong's largest and loudest pro-democracy newspaper.

text.headline: media
text.text: Hong Kong's legislature passed a new film censorship law on Wednesday to "safeguard national security," though critics say it will dampen creativity in its world famous movie industry and further reduce freedoms in the former British colony.

text.headline: us
text.text: A participant in the 1989 Tiananmen Square student-led protest who later became an immigration lawyer in Queens, New York, was allegedly stabbed to death on Monday by a client.

text.headline: politics
text.text: The Justice Department has charged five people with helping the Chinese Communist Party stalk, harass or spy on political dissidents in the US, including a congressional candidate and a Los Angeles sculpture artist, according to new court filings and a press release.

text.headline: business
text.text: The International Finance Corporation, one of the world's leading development banks, has for decades touted its success in funding companies it says can help end extreme poverty in developing countries.

text.headline: asia
text.text: As Taiwan marks 75 years since the 228 incident, interest in the island's painful journey to democracy is growing -- as are fears that it could be taken away.

text.headline: opinions
text.text: The Chinese Communist Party and the Chinese people are mostly indifferent to who wins in November, writes Jiang Xueqin. The 2020 American election has confirmed to Chinese, already distracted by China's decline, that democracy is a circus." Every Chinese I know believes that the United States and China are in a long-term struggle to define the international order, that Trump has initiated a Second Cold War, and that Biden will institutionalize it."

text.headline: opinions
text.text: Kelly Hammond, a historian of China and East Asia, explains why she found Disney's live-action film 'Mulan' to be a 'boring, drab and inaccurate mess.'

text.headline: politics
text.text: The US intelligence community's top election security official said in a statement Friday that China "prefers" an outcome where President Donald Trump is not reelected in November and Russia is working to "denigrate" former Vice President Joe Biden's White House bid.

text.headline: china
text.text: When US President Richard Nixon walked down the red-carpeted stairs from Air Force One to shake hands with Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai on a cold day in Beijing on February 21, 1972, it was hailed by many as a world-changing gesture.

text.headline: china
text.text: When China's leader Xi Jinping opens the Beijing Olympics on Friday he will be flanked by leaders who are unlikely to quell the chorus of concerns these Games are bolstering an authoritarian regime.

text.headline: politics
text.text: When President Joe Biden spoke Friday with Chinese President Xi Jinping, it wasn't just another phone call in an ongoing flurry of telephone diplomacy.

text.headline: politics
text.text: President Joe Biden sought to use a 110-minute video call on Friday to dissuade his Chinese counterpart from assisting Russia in its war on Ukraine, a pivotal moment that could determine the trajectory of the bloody conflict.

text.headline: business
text.text: The path has been cleared for Nigeria's Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala to become the first woman and the first African to lead the World Trade Organization after South Korea's candidate pulled out of the race for the job.

text.headline: china
text.text: Chinese citizens in Ukraine find themselves in a tense situation as plans for an evacuation from the war-torn country have stalled, leaving those who remain wary about potential backlash.

text.headline: china
text.text: China's envoy to the United Nations on Monday called for "all parties" to exercise restraint and avoid "fueling tensions" in Ukraine, but stopped short of condemning the Kremlin's recognition of independence for two pro-Moscow regions in the east of the country.

text.headline: china
text.text: In a year when all Xi Jinping craved was for things to be stable, 2022 is shaping up to be anything but.

text.headline: asia
text.text: President Xi Jinping said Tuesday that China is willing to "work actively" with the international community to mediate the war in Ukraine, but did not offer details and reiterated his opposition to Western sanctions against Russia.

text.text: Speaking before an elite audience in Washington in March 2000, then US President Bill Clinton summarized much of Western thinking on the internet when he hailed a new century in which "liberty will be spread by cell phone and cable modem."

text.text: Beijing has accused the U.S. of working with so-called separatists in Hong Kong and Taiwan to undermine China and plunge it into chaos.

text.text: Weibo, China's answer to Twitter, has long been a prime target for stringent online censorship thanks to its broad audience base and ability to help influence public opinion.

text.headline: china
text.text: As Russian missiles flew through the Ukrainian sky Thursday and world leaders decried an invasion spreading across the country, China refused to condemn Russia's move outright, while appearing to levy blame on the United States and its allies.

text.headline: world
text.text: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping issued a call for NATO to halt further expansion during a meeting on the sidelines of the Beijing Olympics on Friday.

text.headline: world
text.text: Chinese President Xi Jinping celebrated his 66th birthday Saturday alongside Russian President Vladimir Putin, who surprised him with ice cream, the Kremlin said in a statement.

text.headline: business
text.text: China has relaxed restrictions on imports of Russian wheat, a move that could address food security concerns in the world's second largest economy and ease the impact of Western sanctions on Russia.

text.headline: china
text.text: US national security adviser Jake Sullivan met Monday with top Chinese diplomat Yang Jiechi in Rome, Chinese state broadcaster CGTN reported.

text.headline: asia
text.text: As the world focuses on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a delegation of former US officials has signaled American support for another democracy that's come under increasing pressure from an authoritarian power.

text.headline: china
text.text: As the world's attention focuses on the escalating crisis between Russia and Ukraine, a spotlight has also been turned on an island halfway around the world -- self-governing Taiwan.

text.headline: asia
text.text: When Chinese President Xi Jinping welcomes leaders from around the world for the Opening Ceremony of the Beijing Olympics on Friday, it will be his first time meeting foreign counterparts face-to-face in more than 400 days. And at the top of his guest list is Russia's Vladimir Putin.

text.headline: media
text.text: More than two decades after its release, "Fight Club" has been given a very different ending in China — and this time, the authorities win.

text.headline: china
text.text: As some 100 countries prepare to convene virtually for US President Joe Biden's Summit for Democracy, China is busy trying to convince the world that it's also a democracy -- and its version is superior to the United States.

text.headline: china
text.text: China's birthrate in 2020 has hit another record low -- and there's no indication things are about to pick up anytime soon.

text.headline: china
text.text: Virtual summit between US President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping saw no substantive policy on key issues but established a dialogue that can potentially ease tensions and allow for a return to a more constructive, stable relationship.

text.headline: china
text.text: Chinese leader Xi Jinping has further cemented his power at a key meeting of the Communist Party elite, overseeing the passing of a landmark resolution that paves the way for him to secure a third term in office.

text.headline: china
text.text: As Chinese leader Xi Jinping looks set to seek a third term in power, he is seemingly preoccupied with the past, not the future.

text.headline: travel
text.text: With overseas travel severely restricted by China's zero-Covid policy, Chinese influencers have come up with creative ways to bring seemingly exotic scenes into their social media feeds.

text.text: Fifty years ago today, representatives from around the world convened at the United Nations headquarters in New York for a history-shifting vote.

text.text: "Let's fight a 'people's war' against the spies, so that they cannot move a single step and have no place to hide!"

text.headline: china
text.text: The first woman assigned to work on China's new space station will be aboard when the Shenzhou-13 spacecraft blasts off early Saturday local time, in what's set to be a landmark moment for female astronauts and the country's rapidly expanding space program.

text.headline: china
text.text: China's increased military activity in the Taiwan Strait may have grabbed all the headlines in recent weeks, but thousands of miles to the west, another simmering territorial dispute on the country's borders looks more likely to boil over first.

text.headline: china
text.text: Last week, as China celebrated the 72nd anniversary of Communist Party rule with a week-long public holiday, state-run media cranked up the patriotism to hail the country's economic rise, military achievements, political clout -- and even the height of its men.

text.headline: china
text.text: Almost two years into the Covid-19 pandemic, some of the world's major business hubs -- including New York, London and Paris -- are reopening as travel restrictions relax and daily life resumes.

text.text: Once a rising star in law enforcement and widely regarded ally of Xi Jinping, he was the man in charge of a special investigation that brought down the most powerful official in the Chinese President's sweeping anti-corruption campaign.

text.text: For Beijing, the return of Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou to China after a prolonged extradition fight with the United States has been celebrated as a resounding victory.

text.text: He is one of the most recognizable faces on Chinese television. She was a 21-year-old intern working on his show.

text.text: Simu Liu, star of Marvel's new blockbuster "Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings," has enjoyed positive reviews around the world since the movie's release, barring one notable exception: his birthplace.

text.headline: china
text.text: Even for a powerful authoritarian state, the speed and extent to which the Communist Party is expanding its reach into private lives in China has caught many off guard.

text.headline: china
text.text: The deadly effects of climate change -- increasingly extreme, unpredictable weather that cities were never designed to withstand -- have never been so apparent.

text.headline: china
text.text: Beijing wants foreign vessels to give notice before entering "Chinese territorial waters," providing maritime authorities with detailed information -- including the ship's name, call sign, current position, next port of call and estimated time of arrival.

text.text: The crackdown came quickly and sweepingly, wiping out some of China's biggest stars and fan clubs in a matter of days.

text.headline: china
text.text: Faced with a worrying demographic crisis of its own making, China is encouraging couples to have more children.

text.headline: china
text.text: The chaotic US withdrawal from Afghanistan has presented Beijing with a propaganda boost, with Chinese state media capitalizing on the crisis to trumpet the supposed decline of America and taunt Taiwan with threats of invasion.

text.headline: china
text.text: The security challenges posed by the abrupt return of the Taliban are far more pressing for policy makers in Beijing, than any strategic interests down the road.

text.headline: china
text.text: After spending nearly 1,000 days in a Chinese jail cell, Canadian businessman Michael Spavor has finally received his court verdict — yet there is still no clarity on how much longer he will actually remain behind bars.

text.headline: china
text.text: Two explosive rape allegations have rocked China in recent weeks, turning a spotlight on the country's stifled #MeToo movement and problems of sexual assault.

text.headline: china
text.text: The Olympics has long been an occasion for celebrating national pride. And for an increasingly confident China, the Tokyo Games is seen as the latest opportunity to showcase its national strength, as it looks to challenge the United States for top spot on the medal table.

text.headline: china
text.text: As record heat waves hit western North America and deadly floods swept Germany, the growing risks associated with climate change have grabbed headlines, and prompted widespread discussions in the West.

text.headline: china
text.text: Last week, the Biden administration warned American companies about the risk of doing business in Hong Kong, citing Beijing's increasing crackdown on the city.

text.headline: china
text.text: The death of nine Chinese workers in a bus explosion in Pakistan has underscored the security risks attached to China's overseas projects, as anti-China sentiment simmers in countries where official ties with Beijing are strong.

text.headline: china
text.text: Days after entering its second century, the Chinese Communist Party has set out its priority for the new era -- tightening ideological control over 1.4 billion Chinese people.

text.headline: asia
text.text: One is a government accused of detaining more than 1 million Muslims in a vast system of internment camps. The other is one of the world's strictest Islamist militant groups. Yet despite their differences, the Chinese Communist Party and the Taliban may soon find themselves working together, at least tentatively.

text.text: Editor's note: CNN has launched the Meanwhile in China newsletter, a three-times-a-week update exploring what you need to know about the country's rise and how it impacts the world. Sign up here.

text.headline: politics
text.text: In his first joint address to Congress, President Joe Biden struck an optimistic tone, speaking for more than an hour and pushing his expansive vision of building America "back better" by touting his vast infrastructure plan and praising the progress the country has made against Covid-19.

text.headline: politics
text.text: Russia has asked China for military support, including drones, as well as economic assistance for its unprovoked invasion of Ukraine, according to conversations CNN had with two US officials.

text.headline: politics
text.text: President Joe Biden will speak with Chinese President Xi Jinping Friday for their first known discussion in months, the White House said Thursday.

text.headline: world
text.text: Can the US and China ping-pong their way to peace again?

text.headline: world
text.text: Never in the modern histories of the United States and China has antagonism been so high ahead of a major leaders' summit.

text.headline: world
text.text: China's rising military might and demonstrated willingness to ignore agreements it once made over Hong Kong's one-country-two-systems formula are changing the US strategic outlook for Taiwan. Since last Friday, China has dispatched nearly 150 warplanes into Taiwan's defense zone -- part of what the State Department describes as a series of "destabilizing" actions in the Taiwan Strait that risk resulting in "miscalculations." The self-governing island's defense minister, Chiu Kuo-cheng, has also warned that Beijing will have the capacity within four years to mount a "full scale" invasion.

text.headline: world
text.text: The swift release of two Canadians after a diplomatic deal ended a standoff over Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou, who faced extradition from Canada to the US, is a troubling sign of a new era of superpower confrontation.

text.headline: world
text.text: Amid an Olympic gold rush and a worsening pandemic, something else is happening that may ultimately do far more to shape the world: Already bitter relations between the United States and China are turning incredibly toxic.

text.headline: world
text.text: A new generation of US cold warriors just got some powerful validation.

text.headline: world
text.text: Jimmy Lai fled mainland China more than 60 years ago, smuggling himself into Hong Kong on a fishing boat at age 12 to escape the chaos of the Communist Party. This week, Beijing finally caught up with him, after a law it had imposed on Hong Kong last year was used to take down his pro-democracy newspaper Apple Daily.

text.headline: world
text.text: US presidents don't normally go to Europe and keep talking about China. But Joe Biden thinks he's convinced his new European friends of the need to stand up to Chinese autocracy, human rights abuses and economic rule-breaking.

text.headline: world
text.text: Biden tends to refract many domestic questions through a prism of China's growing might and the need to build American competitiveness.

text.headline: world
text.text: A devastating independent report accusing China of across-the-board genocide in Xinjiang leaves the rest of the world with two questions: What to do, and will it make any difference?

text.text: Fans across China temporarily crashed the country's leading social media platform on Tuesday, as tens of millions rushed online to celebrate teenage freeski sensation Eileen Gu winning her first gold medal at the Beijing Olympics.

text.text: Ladies, gentlemen and friends, hello. (We) have kept you all waiting. It's a great pleasure to meet with friends from the press.

text.text: Washington is adding 28 Chinese companies, government offices and security bureaus to a United States blacklist over their alleged role in facilitating human rights abuses in China's Xinjiang region.

text.headline: asia
text.text: Every day, US-based Uyghur journalist Gulchehra Hoja tries to call her family in the Chinese region of Xinjiang. Sometimes she tries up to 20 different numbers, just hoping that someone will pick up.

text.text: CNN's Steven Jiang, a member of the first generation of China's one-child rule, looks at his childhood world of single kids.

text.text: As New Year's Eve messages go, Xi Jinping's speech on national television was almost pitch-perfect.

text.text: If you live in China and haven't watched -- or at least heard about -- Chai Jing's "Under the Dome," you must have been living under a rock.

text.text: The memories are still raw for 78-year-old Wang Jinxiang.

text.text: The United States and China have agreed to relax visa restrictions on each other's journalists, according to officials from both countries.

text.text: China's three-person crew arrived at the new Tiangong space station Saturday morning -- a major step for the country's young space program, rapidly becoming one of the world's most advanced.

text.text: China has passed sweeping new rules about the collection and use of personal data as Beijing toughens its regulation of the country's tech companies.

text.headline: china
text.text: The breakdown in US-China relations is due to some people in the United States treating China as an "imaginary enemy," Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Xie Feng was quoted as saying during a meeting with US Deputy Secretary of State Wendy Sherman on Monday, according to a statement provided by the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

text.headline: china
text.text: China's rise is a "historical inevitability" and it will no longer be "bullied, oppressed or subjugated" by foreign countries, its leader, Xi Jinping, said Thursday during an event commemorating the 100th anniversary of the Chinese Communist Party.

text.headline: china
text.text: For a decidedly atheist political organization, China's ruling Communist Party is fond of talking about its origins in religious terms.

text.text: Before the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics, Lincoln Mitchell says he had never heard of Eileen Gu, who coincidentally played sports at the same high school he did in California.

text.headline: sport
text.text: Representing China, California-born figure skater Zhu Yi is facing a firestorm of attack on Chinese social media after she fell flat on the ice and finished last in a women's short program team event Sunday.

text.headline: china
text.text: In the span of a week, three American-born athletes of Chinese descent have been thrust into the spotlight at the Beijing Winter Olympics -- to very different reactions in China.

text.headline: china
text.text: A Chinese policeman turned whistleblower has revealed rare details on what he described as a systematic campaign of torture against ethnic Uyghurs in the Xinjiang region's detention camps -- claims China has denied for years.

text.headline: tech
text.text: Chinese social media platform Weibo Corp has been slapped with a 3 million yuan ($470,000) fine by China's internet regulator for repeatedly publishing illegal information.

text.headline: china
text.text: Even in death, the Chinese government continues to censor Liu Xiaobo.

text.headline: china
text.text: China detains and interrogates scores of human rights lawyers and activists, prompting condemnation from the U.S. government and advocacy groups.

text.headline: china
text.text: The United States and its allies are stepping up pressure on China in a unified show of force against Beijing's alleged repression of Uyghurs, a predominantly Muslim ethnic minority, in the country's western region of Xinjiang.

text.text: A professional esports player from Hong Kong has been banned from a top worldwide tournament after shouting a protest slogan.

text.text: Chinese President Xi Jinping has praised George H.W. Bush's role in helping to improve China-US relations, in a tribute to the former president of the United States who died on Saturday at the age of 94.

text.text: When it comes to longevity, forget the Italy or Japan. For a lengthy urban life, Hong Kong is the place to be, topping life expectancy rankings globally.

text.text: The Trump administration's most significant and lasting decisions will be about U.S. policy toward China, Fareed says.

text.text: The Betty Kwan Chinn Homeless Foundation operates three homeless shelters offering hygiene services and an after-school program and partnering with Northern California hospitals and mobile clinics to provide medical services.

text.text: To alleviate poverty, the Chinese government is moving 2 million villagers to cities in Guizhou province. Michele Palazzi photographed a changing way of life.

text.text: After US lawmakers passed a bill banning any imports from Xinjiang made with forced labor, Rep. Carson -- one of three Muslims in Congress -- writes that America must stand up for China's minorities.

text.text: China will provide almost $31 million worth of food, winter weather supplies, vaccines, and medicine to Taliban-controlled Afghanistan, China's Foreign Ministry said Wednesday.

text.text: A Navy officer charged with espionage was arrested as he boarded a flight to mainland China, a U.S. defense official told CNN.

text.headline: politics
text.text: A unnamed Navy officer has been charged with espionage and attempted espionage in a proceeding that has been designated a national security case.

text.headline: politics
text.text: The US government has spent the past week assessing a report of a leak at a Chinese nuclear power plant, after a French company that part owns and helps operate it warned of an "imminent radiological threat," according to US officials and documents reviewed by CNN.

text.headline: politics
text.text: President Donald Trump addressed the escalating situation in Hong Kong Tuesday, saying US intelligence indicates "the Chinese Government is moving troops to the Border," but security officials tell CNN that Beijing regularly maintains a force presence there.

text.headline: politics
text.text: The US Air Force wants to add more bombers, fighters, tankers and other front-line units by 2030 to confront rising threats from China and Russia, senior officials said Monday, outlining a proposal for what the service will need to fight and win future conflicts.

text.headline: politics
text.text: Despite strong opposition from China, the Obama administration authorized a $1.83 billion weapons sale to Taiwan Wednesday.

text.headline: politics
text.text: Blunt US rhetoric heading into President Joe Biden's call with Chinese President Xi Jinping suggested that a meeting of the minds on Russia's brutality in Ukraine was unlikely, and reflects the current bitter tensions between Washington and Beijing.

text.text: Japan has backed its condemnation of war in Ukraine with sanctions on Russian officials and oligarchs, but experts say they're not the only audience for Tokyo's outrage -- China is meant to get the message, too.

text.headline: asia
text.text: Japan is drawing a red line around an island chain also claimed by China, pushing back at Beijing's increasingly aggressive military posturing, and setting the stage for a potential showdown between the region's two biggest powers.

text.headline: china
text.text: A London-based independent tribunal has ruled that China committed genocide against Uyghurs and other ethnic minorities in its western Xinjiang region, accusing China's senior leadership including President Xi Jinping of "primary responsibility" for acts perpetrated against Muslim minority groups.

text.headline: asia
text.text: As Hong Kong's protest movement has gone on, it has turned into something bigger -- and darker.

text.headline: china
text.text: Those who aspire to join China's Communist Party face tighter membership rules -- a move that Xi Jinping hopes that will leave only the most devoted members.

text.headline: asia
text.text: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi called him a "dear friend." Chinese leader Xi Jinping went a step further, calling him his "best and bosom friend."

text.headline: media
text.text: In the past year, two of Hong Kong's biggest pro-democracy media outlets were toppled after enormous government pressure, a series of arrests and police raids on their newsrooms.

text.text: The group was approaching fellow diners at a McDonald's in a Chinese city on a Wednesday night, asking for their cellphone numbers, when a woman refused.

text.headline: asia
text.text: In a new study, researchers are suggesting that around 25 million of China's "missing girls" aren't actually missing, but appear on government censuses at a later stage in their lives.

text.headline: asia
text.text: When an ancient poem appeared on the side of aid packages sent from Japan to China in the fight against the coronavirus outbreak, nobody thought it would help strengthen ties between Tokyo and Beijing.

text.headline: asia
text.text: On July 1, 2017 Hong Kong marks 20 years since the city's handover to China in 1997. How has the city changed since then?

text.headline: world
text.text: Typhoon Soudelor lashed Saipan, Taiwan and parts of China with winds around 100 miles per hour. Charities and NGO's around the world have stepped up to help.

text.headline: asia
text.text: China is closely watching the events in Ukraine to evaluate its own strategy towards Taiwan, the island's foreign minister has warned.

text.headline: asia
text.text: China sent 39 warplanes into Taiwan's air defense identification zone (ADIZ) on Sunday, Taiwan's Defense Ministry said, the largest such incursion this year.

text.headline: tech
text.text: The chief financial officer of Chinese tech giant Huawei has been released on bail in Canada, setting her up for a lengthy legal fight over extradition to the United States.

text.headline: tech
text.text: China's anger is growing over the arrest of a top Chinese tech executive wanted by the United States. A Canadian court on Monday delayed its decision on whether she should be let out on bail.

text.headline: business
text.text: The chief financial officer of Chinese tech company Huawei will have to wait another day to learn if she'll be let go on bail.

text.headline: politics
text.text: The Justice Department is ending its three-year-old China Initiative, a national security program intended to thwart China's intelligence activities in the US, including those aimed at stealing emerging technology from research universities, in the wake of a string of dismissals of cases and complaints that it fueled suspicion and bias against innocent Chinese Americans.

text.headline: asia
text.text: The Dalai Lama's plans to visit a picturesque Buddhist town in India's northeast have sparked renewed tensions between Beijing and New Delhi.

text.headline: asia
text.text: Hong Kong's summer of discontent has spilled over into fall, bringing with it tear gas, petrol bombs and widespread transport disruptions -- all the elements that have divided the city during four months of unrest.

text.headline: asia
text.text: Taiwan on Thursday showed off its newest military hardware -- upgraded F-16 fighter jets that would be at the heart of the island's defense in the event of an air attack from China.

text.headline: asia
text.text: The leader of Taiwan, the island thrust into the center of rising tensions between the United States and China, said the threat from Beijing is growing "every day," as for the first time she confirmed the presence of American troops on Taiwanese soil.

text.headline: asia
text.text: The small bedroom is frozen in time. The two little girls who used to sleep here disappeared along with their mother more than two years ago.

text.headline: politics
text.text: Commentary editor Noah Rothman said President-elect Donald Trump's recent phone call with Taiwan's president -- and its diplomatic fallout -- is a sign of an incoming administration that is "winging it" more than some Republicans want to admit.

text.headline: world
text.text: A heated back-and-forth between China and Canada kicked off in the final hours of the UN General Assembly Monday, after Canadian Foreign Minister Marc Garneau referenced the "two Michaels" recently released from detention in China.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The British government had been directing investors towards the law firm run by a woman accused by the country's own intelligence service of political interference on behalf of China for years, documents from its trade department show.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The United Kingdom's domestic spy agency has warned British lawmakers that a woman connected to the Chinese Communist Party has been working to interfere in the UK political process.

text.headline: asia
text.text: In his first international television interview since being re-elected in May, Indonesian President Joko Widodo denied being concerned about the rise of fundamentalism in his country, saying that the Islam practiced there is tolerant and progressive.

text.headline: asia
text.text: Many people take up photography to find meaning in the moment, but for Douglas So, it is about capturing history.

text.headline: americas
text.text: Nicaragua's government has broken off diplomatic relations with Taiwan and embraced Beijing, declaring "there is only one China in the world."

text.headline: asia
text.text: Vietnam's largest cinema chain has pulled a new Dreamworks animated movie from theaters because it features a map asserting Chinese ownership over the South China Sea.

text.headline: business
text.text: Li-Ning goods will be detained by US authorities after US Customs and Border Protection said an investigation indicated that the Chinese sportswear giant uses North Korean labor in its supply chain.

text.headline: business
text.text: Switzerland, a major hub for storing wealth that is popular with Russian oligarchs, is breaking with its tradition of neutrality to sanction Russia.

text.headline: media
text.text: "Fight Club" is almost back to its original state in China.

text.headline: opinions
text.text: Imagine, for a moment, what the world looks like to people living in China today — say, to an average couple.

text.headline: europe
text.text: With its glittering skyscrapers and countless new developments, Beijing is a thoroughly modern city. But beyond this are the remains of hundreds of years of history.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Britain has denied that Neil Heywood, a businessman whose death is at the heart of a political scandal in China, was a spy working for the British government.

text.headline: europe
text.text: UK Foreign Secretary William Hague said Tuesday that a Chinese probe into the death of a British businessman followed repeated British requests for an inquiry.

text.headline: europe
text.text: A Spanish judge issues arrest warrants for China's former President Jiang Zemin and former Prime Minister Li Peng for alleged genocide against Tibetans.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Vogue China editor, Angelica Cheung says that many global brands are failing to grasp the complex, multi-layered reality of China's luxury market.

text.headline: sport
text.text: A Polish athlete who won gold at the World Athletics Championships in Beijing has denied reports he used the gong to pay for a taxi after a drunken celebration.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Swiss customs officials seize around 262 kilograms (578 pounds) of elephant ivory destined for China in a random airport check on three Chinese travelers.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Chinese President  Xi Jinping addressed the British Parliament on Tuesday as he began a visit that has aroused concern among human rights activists.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Children descend a half-mile cliff on unsteady vine ladders to reach school in the mountains of China's Sichuan province.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Queen Elizabeth has been caught on camera saying Chinese officials were "very rude" during President Xi Jinping's first state visit to the UK last year.

text.headline: sport
text.text: Monday was Father's Day in Taiwan, and weightlifter Hsu Shu-ching gave her dad the best present he could ask for: an Olympic gold medal.

text.headline: sport
text.text: Tears rolled down Chen Shih-hsin's cheeks as, olive wreath atop her head and medal around her neck, she saluted the flag that rose above the stadium.

text.headline: tennis
text.text: China's first major tennis champion is still a winner when it comes to business, earning $20 million last year. CNN spoke to her agent about her business interests and plans to build 'Li Na Land'.

text.headline: europe
text.text: China has warned its nationals to respect local laws after two Chinese tourists were detained in Berlin for performing a Nazi salute in front of the Reichstag.

text.headline: football
text.text: Dressed in red and armed with flags, fans of Hong Kong's national football team politely applauded the Lebanese anthem while they waited to seize their moment.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Sweden has charged a 49-year-old Tibetan man with spying on fellow exiles on behalf of Beijing.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The UK Foreign Secretary made what he described as a "terrible mistake" during a visit to China when he accidentally described his Chinese wife as Japanese in a meeting in Beijing.

text.headline: uk
text.text: A Chinese state media journalist who was caught on camera slapping a volunteer at the UK Conservative Party conference has been charged with common assault.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Interpol said Sunday it had received the resignation of its president, deepening the mystery of the disappearance of Meng Hongwei, a Chinese government official who has been missing since last week.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Interpol said Saturday it has asked Chinese authorities for information about the agency's president, Meng Hongwei, who was reported missing Thursday.

text.headline: europe
text.text: The Chinese president of Interpol, the international police agency, has vanished.

text.headline: uk
text.text: A journalist working for Chinese state media was removed from a fringe event discussing Hong Kong at the UK Conservative Party conference on Sunday after loudly protesting a speaker.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The UK Foreign Office says it is "very concerned" by Hong Kong's "unprecedented" rejection of a visa for the Financial Times' Asia news editor, Victor Mallet.

text.headline: uk
text.text: British diplomats who visited Xinjiang, in China's remote northwest, have confirmed reports that large numbers of Muslims are being held in so-called "vocational education centers."

text.headline: europe
text.text: European Union leaders sat down last week for what was supposed to be a summit meeting to discuss China, perhaps the biggest external economic and diplomatic challenge currently facing the EU.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Italy may be about to sign up to China's Belt and Road Initiative, becoming the largest economy yet to join the global infrastructure initiative, a signature policy of Chinese President Xi Jinping.

text.headline: sport
text.text: Li Na, Asia's first major singles tennis champion,  talks exclusively to CNN Sport about her life as a mother and the new movie based on her life.

text.headline: uk
text.text: British Prime Minister Theresa May has fired her Defense Secretary Gavin Williamson over the leaking of a key decision related to the Chinese telecoms company Huawei from a UK National Security Council meeting.

text.headline: uk
text.text: A Huawei executive was denounced as a "moral vacuum" in a heated UK parliamentary committee hearing Monday, as lawmakers repeatedly compared the Chinese technology company to Nazi Germany collaborators.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Chinese President Xi Jinping had the ultimate tour guide on his visit to the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum this week: His "bosom friend," Russian President Vladimir Putin.

text.headline: football
text.text: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has refuted claims his club behaved disrespectfully while on a pre-season tour to China.

text.headline: australia
text.text: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has described China's accusation that an Australian citizen detained in Beijing had acted as a spy as "absolutely untrue"

text.headline: australia
text.text: Chinese-Australian writer Yang Hengjun has been arrested on espionage charges in Beijing, seven months after being detained in southern China.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Angela Merkel was welcomed by Premier Li Keqiang in Beijing on Friday amid calls for the German Chancellor to take a stronger line on China's human rights record.

text.headline: uk
text.text: All 39 people who were found dead in a truck in a UK industrial park on Wednesday were Chinese nationals, British police said Thursday, as officers in England, Northern Ireland and Belgium scrambled to establish the chain of events that led to the tragic incident.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The deaths of 39 people found in a truck in a UK industrial park this week has sparked horror and revulsion around the world.

text.headline: australia
text.text: A man who left Australia shortly before a woman was found dead in a freezer in his apartment is being questioned by authorities in China's central Sichuan province, New South Wales (NSW) police announced Thursday.

text.headline: uk
text.text: British lawmakers have warned of what they say is "alarming evidence" of Chinese influence on university campuses, and the potential risks to academic freedom of UK institutions targeting partnerships in China.

text.headline: sport
text.text: New Zealand rugby star Sonny Bill Williams has joined soccer player Mesut Ozil in speaking out against alleged human rights abuses by the Chinese government in the country's far-western Xinjiang region.

text.headline: football
text.text: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has backed Arsenal soccer star Mesut Ozil in condemning China's treatment of its Muslim Uyghur minority.

text.headline: football
text.text: With an hour gone and a sorry Arsenal trailing 3-0 to Manchester City Sunday, Mesut Ozil was substituted. He trudged from the pitch and as he approached the Arsenal bench petulantly kicked his gloves into the air.

text.headline: football
text.text: Chinese state media on Sunday pulled coverage of Arsenal's English Premier League game against Manchester City after its midfielder Mesut Ozil posted social media messages in support of China's Muslim Uyghur minority.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Europe has a China problem.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The UK government may give greater rights to Hong Kong residents who possess a special kind of British passport (BNOs) -- granted when Britain handed control of the territory back to China -- unless the Chinese government suspends its proposed, and highly contentious, national security legislation.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Before coronavirus brought the world to its knees, 2020 was slated to be a crucial year for the European Union and China.

text.headline: europe
text.text: The Covid-19 pandemic has kick started a difficult global conversation about whether Western liberal democracies should radically rethink their relationships with China, an authoritarian regime upon whom many of these nations' economies rely.

text.headline: australia
text.text: Chinese students in Australia are being coerced by criminal gangs to fake their own kidnappings as part of an elaborate global extortion racket targeting vulnerable overseas communities, authorities said Monday.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The UK will suspend its extradition treaty with Hong Kong "immediately and indefinitely" due to the controversial national security law implemented in the city by mainland China.

text.headline: uk
text.text: When the UK announced its U-turn on allowing the Chinese telecoms giant Huawei to play a part in the country's 5G network, it signaled an end to the so-called "golden era" of UK-China relations. To the delight of US President Donald Trump, the UK would seemingly no longer equivocate on its national security in order to balance its relationship with China -- and would instead adopt something closer to a US-style hard line.

text.headline: uk
text.text: British Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab has questioned whether China can be trusted to live up to international obligations after its move to introduce a new security law for Hong Kong, which London says contravenes the historical agreement handing over the territory to Beijing.

text.headline: europe
text.text: For more than 70 years, the transatlantic alliance has served as the unshakable foundation of European stability and underpinned the values of the US-led Western order. In 2020, it appears that relationship is being rethought on both sides of the Atlantic.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The United Kingdom said Wednesday it would offer a path to citizenship for eligible Hong Kong residents and condemned China's new security law as a threat to the city's freedom.

text.headline: europe
text.text: China's decision to move its British embassy from London's upmarket West End to the less glitzy east could have been a heart-warming tale of homecoming. The new mission will be built at the former Royal Mint, just a stone's throw from the city's original 19th century Chinatown.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Pope Francis has for the first time publicly named China's Uyghur minority among a list of the world's persecuted peoples, breaking his silence on allegations of widespread human rights abuses in the country's far-western Xinjiang region.

text.headline: europe
text.text: The European Parliament has adopted a resolution which strongly condemns China over allegations of forced labor by minority groups.

text.headline: europe
text.text: The French armed forces now have permission to develop "augmented soldiers" following a report from a military ethics committee.

text.headline: sport
text.text: The United States' determination that China is committing genocide in Xinjiang presents a rare moral predicament for athletes and countries preparing to compete in the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing.

text.headline: europe
text.text: The Dutch parliament on Thursday passed a non-binding motion saying the treatment of the Uyghur Muslim minority in China amounts to genocide, the first such move by a European country.

text.headline: uk
text.text: Britain has called for the United Nations to be given "urgent and unfettered" access to Xinjiang to investigate reports of abuses in the Chinese region.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The BN(O) scheme for Hong Kong nationals is remarkable in its scope as it's also remarkable for another reason: it has been pioneered by the same British politicians who engineered the UK's break from the European Union, in part, to curb immigration.

text.headline: sport
text.text: A letter signed by more than 180 campaign groups calling for a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing warns the Games could "embolden" human rights abuses in China.

text.headline: europe
text.text: Russia is Britain's top security challenge, the UK will build more nuclear weapons and London will expand its presence in the high-tech realms of space and cyberspace, Boris Johnson announced Tuesday in a sweeping review of British military and foreign policy.

text.headline: uk
text.text: Like many of its global counterparts, the United Kingdom is in desperate need of a China strategy.

text.headline: uk
text.text: The United Kingdom has unveiled a £43 million ($59 million) fund to support Hong Kongers emigrating to the country under a new scheme for holders of British National (Overseas) passports.

text.headline: europe
text.text: The European Union has a China problem. The bloc, for financial and strategic reasons, wants to build strong economic ties with Beijing that bolster Brussels' desire to be a serious player on the world stage as the leading light of Western values.

text.headline: europe
text.text: A curious spat has unfolded in recent months between Lithuania, a small, Eastern European nation of fewer than 3 million people, and China, a superpower with an economy that could soon exceed that of the United States.

text.headline: sport
text.text: The Golden State Warriors have distanced themselves from comments made by Chamath Palihapitiya, a part owner who said that "nobody cares about what's happening to the Uyghurs."

text.headline: europe
text.text: In 2022, the European Union must confront some of the most difficult challenges it faces if it is ever to become the geopolitical power its leaders so desperately want it to be.
